Mental Health Consumer.title: Everything at Once
Mental Health Consumer.about: Mental Health Consumer returns to their trademark nostalgic, emotive electro sound with "Everything at Once", a record true to its title. Showcasing a mix of organic and programmed sounds, heartfelt and hard-hitting melodies and beats, and emphasis on the awe and unease of physical and emotional states, "Everything at Once" is a maximal, instant classic in Mental Health Consumer's discography, one that will still surprise and delight listeners familiar with MHC's genre-hopping discography and established sonic identity. Released for Netlabel Day July 14, 2023 - Support independent, creative commons artists and labels!
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released July 14, 2023
All tracks written and produced by Brian Ruskin as Mental Health Consumer. Photography and Design by Brian Ruskin

Mental Health Consumer.title: Far Above the World Tonight
Mental Health Consumer.about:
Conceptual album about a forgotten satellite's messages sent and path above earth, the record is an immersive soundscape of celestial melodies, found sounds, field recordings, and otherworldly effects.
Originally released 2010 on the late Secret Station label, the album has been fully remastered for re-release in 2025
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released January 1, 2010
All tracks written and produced by Brian Ruskin. Additional guitar on tracks 5 and 6 by Peter Nester

Mental Health Consumer.title: Mountain Time
Mental Health Consumer.about: Originally recorded in 2014 upon arrival in Colorado, Mental Health Consumer (Brian Ruskin) has remastered "Mountain Time" for release. Inspired by the epic landscapes of the Rocky Mountains, the album showcases ambient-leaning electronica with programmed sounds integrated with natural recordings and wide sonic soundscapes. Includes a bonus pdf booklet of photos that inspired the tracks. If you like what you hear, please consider a donation to the Boulder County Wildfire Fund  (www.commfound.org)  to support the victims of the 12/30-31/2021 Marshall Fire in Boulder, Colorado. Thanks for listening and for your support.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released April 3, 2022
Written, produced, and designed/photography by Brian Ruskin

Mental Health Consumer.title: R.E.S.T.
Mental Health Consumer.about: "R.E.S.T" is the last track on "Ambia", a collection of ambient soundscapes by Brian Ruskin, released 4/14/09 by the Clinical Archives netlabel. A version of the track was also featured in the Sommeil Concert for Sleep April 11-12, 2009 in New Orleans, curated and mixed by Tanner Menard
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released April 14, 2009
All tracks by Brian Ruskin

trackinfo.title: R.E.S.T.
trackinfo.about: "R.E.S.T." stands for "Restricted Environmental Stimulation Therapy" refers to sensory deprivatiopn followed by the overwhelming felings of awe and wonderment after being released. This track was created for Tanner Menard's "Sommeil" sleep concert, April 11-12, 2009, and is includced on the Clinical Archives netlabel release "Ambia" by Mental Health Consumer
trackinfo.credits:
from R.E.S.T., track released April 14, 2009
Brian Ruskin

Mental Health Consumer.title: Score - 20 years of Mental Health Consumer
Mental Health Consumer.about: Score - compiles 20 years of emotionally intelligent dance music by Mental Health Consumer. This career-spanning collection showcases Mental Health Consumer's unique mix of live and programmed sounds and genres with 20 specially curated and remastered tracks.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released January 31, 2026
All tracks written and produced by Brian Ruskin. Drums on "Unexpected Storm" by Jesse Sprinkle

Mental Health Consumer.title: Secret Treetop Studio
Mental Health Consumer.about: Inspired by life's changes - the hours, seasons, weather, time zones, moods and memories. Melodies emerge from layers of atmospheric sounds, both electronic and organic, some uplifting, others unsettling. "Secret Treetop Studio" is music for those who are overactive on the other side of the clock.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released October 1, 2015
All Tracks Written and Produced by Brian Ruskin, 2012-2013

Mental Health Consumer.title: Subversion
Mental Health Consumer.about: Mental Health Consumer "turns over" recent endeavors with "Subversion", an album that swerves and plunges through dense analog melodies and beats. After recent forays into ambient, "Subversion" finds Mental Health Consumer reexploring the aggressive, off-kilter, and slightly mysterious sounds from the start of their career, while adding experimental interludes and modern production that are unmistakably MHC.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released May 12, 2023
All tracks written and produced by Brian Ruskin as Mental Health Consumer. Photography and design by Brian Ruskin

Mental Health Consumer.title: The Echoes I Sent
Mental Health Consumer.label: EC Underground
Mental Health Consumer.about:
We are honored to present 'The Echoes I Sent,' the remarkable debut release from Brian Ruskinan artist who has shared music as Mental Health Consumer for over 20 yearsnow joining our label family. Capturing a raw, unfiltered glimpse into his creative genius, this album merges shadowy beats with glimmers of melodic guitar, navigating the complex terrains of emotion and introspection. This isnt just music; it's a deep dive into the psyche, where each track builds from a quiet hum to a resonating roar.
Heres what the media have to say:
Odyssey Magazine Review (Dec 5)
odysseymagazines.com/music-1/template-review-rne7n-2mf22-5e6wm-m5wx9-a8zkj
909 Originals Interview Q&A (Nov13)
909originals.com/2025/11/13/909originals-chats-to-mental-health-consumer-about-his-new-album-on-ec-underground/
Obscure Sound Album Review (Nov 7)
www.obscuresound.com/2025/11/mental-health-consumer
Parkett Album Review (Nov 5)
www.parkettchannel.it/mental-health-consumer-the-echoes-i-sent/
The release is available for full streaming exclusively on Bandcamp and will be available on your favorite platforms on the release date: Dec 5, 2025.
Linkhub:  music.imusician.pro/a/xDnwUJqN
While the artist chooses to stay away from social media, his music speaks volumes, offering a profound connection that transcends digital boundaries.
Discover the artist:
>  soundcloud.com/mentalhealthconsumer
>  www.discogs.com/artist/1436905-Mental-Health-Consumer
>  archive.org/search?query=creator%3A%22Mental+Health+Consumer%22
Mental Health Consumer.credits:

Written and Produced by Brian Ruskin
Track 8, Remix/additional production by Dave Hall (Eko_Fisk), and drumming by Jesse Sprinkle.

Mental Health Consumer.title: Too Warm to Be This Late, Too Chilled to Feel Secure
Mental Health Consumer.about:
Nighttime is a source of new perspectives and surprising revelations.
Mental Health Consumer (Brian Ruskin) returns with "Too Warm to Be This Late, Too Chilled to Feel Secure", an ambient journey through the late evening and early morning hours to accompany your sleepless activities. Entirely beatless, the album's emphasis is on shifting atmospheres and sensations. Tracks are named simply by the changing hours, so the listener can project their own meanings. The record is the spiritual sequel to 2016's "Early Spring Midnight Walks With Us" (released on Archaic Horizon records), another ambient excursion through the evening. In addition to the individual tracks, Mental Health Consumer shares a Continuous Mix that emphasizes the transitions in mood as the hours progress - sometimes subtle and gradual, sometimes reactionary and significant, hopefully, contemplative and inspiring.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released January 3, 2022
Written, produced, mixed, and designed by Brian Ruskin as Mental Health Consumer. (cc) 2022 Believe in Billy Records

Mental Health Consumer.title: Turning Corners
Mental Health Consumer.about: Mental Health Consumer's "Turning Corners" is an edgy, anxious, and challenging album of experimental-leaning electronic tracks and soundscapes. Taking the listener on an inward journey, the album is autobiographical, inspired by a very specific unfortunate event and its aftermath, but "Turning Corners" will resonate for all listeners as they consider the juxtaposition of worries and faith, regrets and hope, melancholy and optimism throughout their own experiences. Remastered and continuously mixed, and employing a unique production style, "Turning Corners" will surprise some listeners, though the trademarks of MHC's sounds remain - found sounds, live guitar, skittering beats, field recordings, ambient pads and analog melodies - even if occasionally wandering around darker corners than usual.
Mental Health Consumer.credits:
released June 11, 2022
All tracks written and produced by Brian Ruskin as Mental Health Consumer. Photography and Design by Brian Ruskin
Mental Health Consumer.license: Some rights reserved. Please refer to individual track pages for license info.
